definition: A person or thing that comes before another in a sequence or in a particular role, often used to refer to a predecessor or someone who held a position or role before someone else. It is commonly used in the context of discussing historical figures, leaders, or individuals who held a specific position or title prior to someone else.

examples.german: Mein Vorgänger hat diesen Job gemacht.
Der Vorgänger des aktuellen Modells war sehr beliebt.
examples.english: The predecessor of the current model was very popular.

examples.german: Der Vorgänger des Buches war ein Bestseller.
examples.english: The predecessor of the book was a bestseller.

examples.german: Der Vorgänger des Präsidenten war ein erfolgreicher Politiker.
examples.english: The predecessor of the president was a successful politician.

examples.german: Der Vorgänger des Films war ein großer Erfolg.
examples.english: The predecessor of the movie was a big success.
